document_data.name: Duskreene
document_data.mainbody: Lady '''Duskreene''' was a [[Netherese]] inhabitant of [[Tethgard]], and later, a [[watchghost]].
document_data.Description: She was a [[wraith]]like apparition, with white, snaking hair. Her form was skeletal below the breasts and indeed legless, resembling a living woman above that line.
document_data.Personality: Lady Duskreene was lonely, and friendly.
document_data.Abilities: She was somehow capable of slaying people as a [[watchghost]].
document_data.Activities: In life, Lady Duskreene ruled a small area around [[Tethgard]]. In death, she often watched the area around her old holdings.
document_data.Relationships: During her tenure as a watchghost she'd made an acquaintance of a far-removed descendant of hers, [[Mirt]], who often came tell her of the goings-on in the world. She'd also made an acquaintance of a younger [[Elminster]].
document_data.History:
Prior to the founding of [[Cormyr]], Lady Duskreene, a Netherese,{{cite web/Candlekeep Forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2006)/01-01 - Triel, Malaugrym, Duskreene, Lhaeo}} had ruled the lands of Tethgard in the [[Hullack Forest]]. She was interred in her family crypt and then rose as a watchghost; during her tenure as an [[undead]] over the ruin, she'd made the acquaintance of a younger Elminster, and much later on, of Mirt, who was a remote descendant of her line.

In the late {{YearlinkName|1357}}, Mirt guided [[Delg]], [[Shandril Shessair]] and [[Narm Tamaraith]] to [[Tethgard]] as a safety measure, as they were pursued by [[Zhentilar]]. While there, Mirt was forced to call out to Duskreene to get her aid in destroying the Zhentilar. She later made an acquaintance of his guests.
